Juan Miguel Gonzalez was reluctant to come to the United States, or the Cuban federal government was reluctant to allow him to come, until his lawyer, Greg Craig, confident them the Oughout.S. was seriously interested in transferring custody associated with Elian. CBS News Surgeon Bill Plante has found out there more about the attorney that made his buyer's trip happen.Inside Washington, they say it all depends on who you realize. Power lawyer Craig was a law school classmate of the president and initial lady, and he's the one who went to Cuba to set up for Juan Miguel Gonzales to come here. "We had useful along with productive discussions,Inch Craig said. "I believe the trip was a success." If you have the feeling you've seen Gregory Simon before, you have. He or she was part of Chief executive Clinton's impeachment defense team. Actually, Craig has a reputation hard cases. This individual defended John Hinckley, whom shot President Reagan. He's also dealt with Cuba ahead of. In 1986, the Castro government released Colonel Ricardo Montero Duque, a heir of the Bay involving Pigs invasion. Craig, whom then worked for Senator Edward cullen Kennedy, welcomed Duque back to the particular U.S. He will need all their experience in the Elian situation, for which the really work is still ahead -- brokering a legal contract to hand the six-year-old to his father without having sparking violence. [url=http://www.itainayarit.org.mx/guccibags.html]gucci bags[/url] More than 100 irritated Haitian Americans protested outside the Oughout.S. Immigration office in Miami Mon, criticizing what they named America's double common. Over the weekend a boat full of 400 Haitian, Dominicans and Chinese illegal immigrants ran aground a mile off the California coast. But unlike America's policy to Cuban illegal immigrants, almost all on board this vessel will be sent back to their own personal countries, reports CBS News Correspondent Byron Pitts. "It's a great thing when people will sacrifice to come across these dangerous waters to create America their home,Inch said Bishop Victor Curry, from the Miami NAACP. "But it seems for reasons unknown for our Haitian brothers and sisters there's a double standard."And it is just a standard even To the south Florida's Cuban community questioned Mon. Despite U.Utes.-Cuban policy that allows virtually any illegal who reaches land to stay in America, the case of 6-year-old Elian Gonzaels remains to be unresolved. He's the little boy found floating in an inner conduit Thanksgiving Day. The Immigration and Naturalization Program says his reputation is still undecided. "This has long been an immigrant country,In . said Jose Basulto, ##########. "There is more people in the world than there were before, and with that simple fact of life, the actual U.S. needs to learn to live with the idea.""We will tell them one more time that this boy arrive back and he can come back to a very warm situation," mentioned Joan Brown Campbell of the Oughout.S. National Council of Churches. section of the delegation to Cuba.These two very different incidents highlight one particular big question America will have to confront as being a new wave of refugees come into the Ough.S. ina new one hundred year: is there any space left in the country once welcomed the world in centuries past?(Chemical)2000 CBS Around the world Inc. CBS Media Correspondent John Roberts reviews on the intolerant perspective toward homosexuality which continues in the United States and the careful politicians who are capitalizing on the discord.While the simple fact of a person's homosexuality could possibly be unremarkable in urban centers like New York and Chicago, the Lesbian and Lgbt Task Force reports that 56 percent of Americans still disapprove of same-gender sexual orientation.Mike Wolfe, a sociologist at Boston ma University who studies attitudes toward wide open homosexuality, says Americans take other types of social change a lot more readily. "This could be the issue that never alterations - that people will invariably retain this meaningful preference for one kind of sexuality over one more."Consider David Hartman, a 29-year-old methods analyst from N . California. He makes no effort to cover his bias against homosexuals: "I think it is wrong. I think it is unnatural. I do not think people were designed to have sex with he identical gender."The Republican leadership recognizes an advantage in keeping this kind of divisive issue at the center of their political discourse. On the Armstrong Williams Show, Economic council chair majority leader 2 Lott fanned the flames together with moral rhetoric: "Is homosexuality a new sin? It is a failure; yes, it is."Statements like Lott's may help some people justify their prejudice, however for others it is a call to action. Joan Garry, executive director with the Gay and Lesbian Alliance Versus Defamation (GLAAD), attributes intolerance to lack of understanding. "There's ignorance, there's fear, there's concern with difference...They need to be knowledgeable...They need to get to know gays and lesbians." [url=http://itainayarit.org.mx/michaelkorsbags.html]cheap michael kors bags[/url] Michael J. Fox can be adored by film and sitcom viewers as an endearing smart guy. Wednesday that became known Sibel has Parkinson's disease. Cbs television studios News Correspondent Harry Smith reports.It's rare that Parkinson's disease strikes someone therefore young and vital. Fox is only Thirty seven years old."It's very rare to get Parkinson's disease under the age of 40 however it is not unheard of," mentioned Neurologist Dr. Stanley Fahn, concerning 11 percent of our own patients had onset before the age of Forty."Parkinson's is a degenerative brain ailment which usually occurs in the elderly. It causes muscle mass tremors and brutally debilitates movement.Fox, who was clinically determined seven years ago, experienced brain surgery last March to alleviate his most unfortunate symptoms."I would suspect the reason he [Fox] got surgery early can be he wanted to get that tremor under control," mentioned Dr. Fahn.It was probably not necessarily under control with the drugs and surgery supplied that ability to get rid of the tremor and therefore he can continue to act.Medications for Parkinson's can help first sufferers manage his or her disease. Clearly this will be relevant in Fox's case because he is not only the legend but the executive producer of his Xyz sitcom.There are times their arms and wrists are so stiff, he states he cannot get a TV handy remote control.In an interview in the forthcoming People magazine, he confess he slowing down to compensate for that disease.With characteristic humor Fox provides, "when he's shaking, their can mix a new margarita a in five seconds."(D)1998 CBS Around the world Corp. AP contributed to this report [url=http://jasadmag.com/ralphlaurenpolo.html]ralph lauren polo[/url] Singer Celine Dion, who took some slack from performing to try to get pregnant after having trouble conceiving, said Feb 5th she is expecting a baby next season."We just found out," she said in a statement, adding she and husband-manager Rene Angelil were "completely, absolutely happy" with the news. Spokeswoman Francine Chaloult said Dion's baby was expected in early March."In three weeks, if all goes well, we are going to hear the heart of our own baby, beating inside of my tummy," said Dion, who has distributed millions of records globally and is best known regarding "My Heart Will Go Upon," the theme song to the award-winning movie Titanic .Her assertion also said that Angelil, that had surgery last year to remove a malignant lump on his or her throat, had gotten test results that showed no cancer malignancy. Dion, 32, had been considering fertility treatments inside New York, forcing the girl last week to turn lower an offer to sing at the Montreal funeral of Canadian hockey legend Maurice Richard. In Feb ., Dion filed a $20 million lawsuit against the Nationwide Enquirer tabloid, saying an account it carried reporting she was expectant with twins ended up being false. She stated the story filled the girl with heartache since she had been not able to have a child."This time it's for real I am pregnant," the woman's statement said. "We are completely, totally happy. And we thank God for the excellent joy we've been granted."Over this past year, we went through a terrible test with each other, but we caused it to be through stronger, more detailed, more loving than in the past," she explained. [url=http://ruizmasse.com/ralphlaurenoutlet.html]polo ralph lauren outlet[/url] Weighing as much as a Volkswagen annoy, a weather foretelling of satellite that will wrack upward millions of space miles over the years, shot in to space atop any titan rocket Sunday, Cbs television studios News Correspondent Jerry Bowen studies. From its 500-mile-high orbit, the Quickscat satellite tv for pc will circle world every 100 mins, gathering data in ocean-surface wind speeds as well as direction. And since two-thirds of weather occurs in the world's oceans, Quickscat need to help make forecasting more accurate. "The measurements we have right now are from buoys that are over the equator and from cruises at see," says Jim Graf, the particular project's director. "This musical instrument will provide uniform dimension with a highly adjusted instrument that will look at the complete earth's area, essentially, every day.In . The new satellite, which may see through clouds, may also be able to provide an also earlier warning upon El Nino or La Nina circumstances as they develop inside the Pacific. That will allow people in affected areas additional time to get ready for the storms associated with the weather patterns. And little Quickscat will add to your knowledge of global global warming, according to scientists. "Wind is driving the water circulation," Graf affirms. "Small changes in the wind can have very large changes on a basin or even regional scale in the ocean."The first information from the $93 million task will start arriving inside 60 days, still soon enough to help monitor exactly what promises to be a dynamic Atlantic hurricane time of year.
